New Records: The Dodgers achieved their largest shutout win in playoff history with an 8-0 victory over the Padres.
Key Match Events: Mookie Betts hit a solo home run, Shohei Ohtani drove a ball down the right-field line at high speed, and Will Smith blasted another weak pitch over the center-field fence to seal the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were relaxed and prepared to engage, with Mookie Betts stating that they weren't uptight and were having fun, laughing, and joking during pregame workouts.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts expressed excitement about Game 5, stating that it's a street fight and that his team's desire has got to be more than their opponent's.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series opener featured a monster first punch by Shohei Ohtani, and the Padres haven't scored in 15 innings dating to the second inning of Game 3.
Others: The winner of the game will likely be the favorite to advance to the World Series and win it, and the series will come down to one game, one night, one more bit of drama.
